d:
Bruce Wayne is no longer the man he used to be…
Gotham City is on the brink of chaos once again, but this time, the stakes are more personal than ever. In Batgirl Begins: A Comic About Batman’s Transformation, the Dark Knight faces his most shocking challenge yet—one that will forever change his identity, body, and sense of self.

When Catwoman is kidnapped by the Joker, Batman is ready to risk everything to save her. But the Clown Prince of Crime has a twisted trick up his sleeve—one that forces Bruce Wayne to experience a transformation beyond anything he could have imagined. Through a mysterious experiment, Batman is changed into Batgirl, a new identity that challenges not only his physical form but also his role as Gotham’s protector.

As Bruce struggles with his new body, emotions, and desires, he must navigate a world where his past relationships shift in unexpected ways. With Catwoman now looking at him through a different lens and new temptations arising, the battle isn’t just against Gotham’s criminals—it’s against himself. Torn between duty and personal conflict, Bruce (now Batgirl) faces psychological torment, forbidden desires, and the ultimate question: Can Batman still be Gotham’s hero if he is no longer Batman?

Why Read Batgirl Begins?
A Unique Twist on the Batman Mythos – Experience Bruce Wayne like never before in a deep, psychological exploration of identity and transformation.
Bold Themes & Mature Storytelling – Featuring gender transformation, Netorare, cuckold dynamics, and emotional conflict, this comic pushes boundaries in superhero fiction.
Dark and Gritty Narrative – Inspired by classic Batman stories but with an adult, thought-provoking twist.
High-Quality Artwork – Stunning visuals that capture the intensity, emotion, and raw energy of Gotham’s underbelly.​
